node.title: Lukashenko accused of 'inhuman, gangster-style approach' to migrants
node.alt: Guards patrol a land border from behind barbed wire
node.description: The humanitarian crisis on the Belarusian border deepens as thousands wait while EU nations stiffen border patrols and accuse the Belarusian government of "gangster style" behaviour.
node.content:
["The crisis on the Belarusian border is worsening with a second adjoining\u00a0nation declaring a state of emergency and the European Commission accusing Belarus President Alexander Lukashenko and his government\u00a0of \"gangster style behaviour\".", "The European Commission said\u00a0Belarus\u00a0was illegally offering migrants easy entrance into the EU via its territory.", "\"Upon arrival they are being pushed to the border and forced to make an illegal entry into the European Union,\" said Commission spokesman Peter Stano.", "The comments came as it was reported over 1,000\u00a0migrants shivered in freezing temperatures and huddled around campfires on the\u00a0Belarusian border with Poland on Tuesday in front of razor wire fences and lines of Polish border guards blocking their entry into the EU.", "The EU promised more sanctions on\u00a0Belarus as\u00a0Polish authorities\u00a0braced for further clashes after some migrants used logs, spades and other implements on Monday to try to break down a border fence, escalating a months-long crisis in which at least seven migrants have died.", "Poland and other EU member states accuse\u00a0Belarus\u00a0of encouraging illegal migrants from the Middle East, Afghanistan and Africa to cross the border into the EU in revenge for sanctions already slapped on Minsk over human rights abuses.", "\"The\u00a0Belarusian regime is attacking the Polish border, the EU, in an unparalleled manner,\" Polish President Andrzej Duda said.", "\"We currently have a camp of migrants who are blocked from the\u00a0Belarusian side. There are about 1,000 people there, mostly young men. These are aggressive actions that we must repel, fulfilling our obligations as a member of the European Union.\"", "Poland's Border Guard said it registered 309 illegal attempts to breach the border on Monday and 17 people, mainly Iraqis, were detained.", "", "
Mr Lukashenko's government\u00a0denies creating the migrant crisis.(Reuters:\u00a0Leonid Scheglov/BelTA/Handout)
", "Mr Lukashenko's government, which is backed by Russia, denies engineering the migrant crisis and blames Europe and the United States for the plight of the people stranded at the border.", "Mr Lukashenko and Russian President Vladimir Putin discussed the situation by phone and expressed concern over the build-up of Polish troops at the border, the\u00a0Belarusian state news agency Belta reported on Tuesday.", "\"We will calmly stand up to this.\"", "Russia's Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov suggested the EU provide\u00a0Belarus\u00a0with financial assistance to stop the migrant flows, referencing an earlier deal with Turkey.", "
State of emergency declared\u00a0at Lithuanian border
", "Lithuania's Parliament declared a state of emergency at the country's border with Belarus on Tuesday.", "The state of emergency, which begins at midnight local time\u00a0and is to last a month, allows border guards to use \"mental coercion\" and \"proportional physical violence\" to prevent migrants from entering Lithuania.", "", "
Lithuanian officials have declared a state of emergency at the country's border.(Reuters:\u00a0Leonid Scheglov/BelTA/Handout)
", "Lithuania's declaration bans all travel to within five kilometres of the Belarus border, unless allowed by border guards.", "Mobile phones could be taken away from migrants and public gatherings near the border and in the camps could be forbidden.", "\"The state of emergency is needed to use ... extraordinary measures to remove the serious threat posed to society by the massive influx of foreigners,\" the motion before Parliament said.", "The measures would also deter anyone seeking to aid migrants, Prime Minister Ingrida Simonyte told Parliament.", "\"People who live, and work (near the border) will be able to continue to do so, but people who want to get there to, for instance, pick up the migrants and ferry them to another territory \u2014 it will be harder for them to do so,\" Ms Simonyte said.", "ABC/Reuters"]
